summary: The document is a memorandum dated 2 June 1973, authored by Joseph K. Moore and George C. Liggett, addressed to the Chief of the Building Security Branch. It details a tour of duty report covering the hours from 0900 to 1700, highlighting various security and operational activities. These activities include handling calls, addressing building security issues, and facilitating communications among staff members. The report also documents interactions with external entities such as Newsweek Magazine and describes a specific incident involving a malfunctioning bay door at the South Loading Dock, which was manually secured.
key_findings: The document outlines routine security and operational tasks during a specific shift.
It mentions interactions with external entities like Newsweek Magazine and internal staff communications.
A notable incident involves a malfunctioning bay door at the South Loading Dock, which was manually secured.
The memorandum reflects the procedural nature of security operations within the agency during that period.
